article_text:
Congressional Outlook 2016: Appropriations

Law360, New York (February 18, 2016, 9:59 AM ET) -- ​​



Law360's Expert Analysis congressional outlook series highlights key areas to watch during this election year, featuring commentary from law firm public policy practice leaders, academics and former members of Congress.



_____________________________________________________________________________



Kevin O'Neill



Greg Louer Conventional Washington wisdom views election years in Congress as a mixture of gridlock and political posturing, where lawmakers are focused on politics over policy while waiting for a frantic lame-duck session to conduct the nation’s business. While the political tides often reduce the chances of major legislation moving in an...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: Common election-year malaise in Congress could give way to an unusual burst of policymaking via the appropriations process, say Kevin O’Neill and Greg Louer of Arnold & Porter LLP.
